The Imaginary Begins

Laura Mullen





In the real
Or the consensually
Recognized—but
Flees (for reasons
We may or may not
Know) to be exiled.
Nomad, cosmopolitan,
Refugee. Not Expat
Exactly not that
Timid and judgmental:
Estranged, yes—
But desperately.
The imaginary
Emerges as
“Sacred,” homeless,
Caught at the edge
Of the country
It used to call home
And the country
Which might bear
The name of home
A while. I see you
The imagination says
I see you seeing
Me. Stepping out
Into the lack of father-
Land. I see you:
Tenderly,
Remorselessly.
